column4: maybe I am having a problem mounting the .iso because i created it from a .mdf?
sorry what is an  .mdf
some thing that windows can mount like an image
ok, i assumed that, is it a linux/unix type
dont think so, i got mdf2iso to make it an iso, i read some forum post saying that you couldnt mount .mdf or .mds
run file  *.iso and see what it tells you
err how do you run an iso?
mount -o loop -t iso9660 /path/to/foo.iso /mnt gives me "mount: not a directory"
just  execute   'file  *iso'  and see what  the file command tells you the file type is
*iso is you iso file name
it says iso 9660
then  try   mount  -o loop -t iso9660  *isofile  /mnt    and see what it does
gives me "mount: not a directory"
of course  *isofile  is   /path/path2/isofile
yup
interesting  give me a minute let me look at my notes
i am  running  6.10 live on top of my  suse and have to mount some slices
i think i might have found something, it is trying to loop with /dev/loop0 which i dont have, should I go ahead and make it?
what does losetup do?
setup, deletes, lists, creates you loop devices
please send me the command you used to mount
because what I sent you should work
